name: Whole apt in Boston neighborhood of Brighton
summary: 700sq ft apartment in the Brighton neighborhood of Boston.  Dunkin' Donuts and 7-11 are within a few minutes walk.  House is on the MBTA bus route- less than a 1 min walk to stops-express buses to downtown.  20 min walk to the green line train at Boston College.  5 min car ride to Mass Pike I-90. Logan airport is a 25 minute ride. 20 min walk to the Charles  River.  Also within a few minutes walk or less are several restaurants.
space: Entire 700 sq ft apartment in a quiet multi-family home located in the Brighton neighborhood of Boston. To ensure that all guests/tenants are comfortable and have a pleasant experience, cooking food that leaves pungent odors is not allowed.  No cooking or frying of foods, oils or spices that are heavily aromatic.  Kitchen is for light cooking only.  If this rule is broken an additional fee of $100.00 will be charged for cleaning and airing out of the apartment.  Apt includes large entry way with a desk, 1 bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, dining area and living room. There are 2 queen sized beds, one a pull out sofa bed.  Mattresses are memory gel/foam.  Included is a 50 inch  ROKU tv, wi-fi, and Keurig.  Guests do not have access to the thermostat as it is set for the whole building.  Heat is on 24 hrs a day, 7 days a week.  The heat remains between 70-73 degrees.
description: 700sq ft apartment in the Brighton neighborhood of Boston.  Dunkin' Donuts and 7-11 are within a few minutes walk. Apt includes large entry way with a desk, 1 bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, dining area and living room.
neighborhood_overview: Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks, 7-11 and restaurants are a few minutes walk away.  Apt is on the MBTA bus route. Steps away is the express bus to downtown Boston and other locations.  20 minute walk to the green line train at Boston College stop. 5 minute ride to Mass Pike I-90. Logan airport is a 25 minute ride. 20 minute walk to the Charles  River-rent canoes and kayaks at Charles River Canoe & Kayak: Allston Brighton location.  Free street parking.  Blue Bikes Boston bike rental  is 1.5 blocks away from the home.
notes: Cleaning fee is $80 per stay. Price listed is for 2 guests, per night.  $25 extra per guest, per night.  Please advise host if more than 2 guests will be staying.
transit: There is free street parking. Watch out for street cleaning days. Read the posted signs. Minute walk to the MBTA bus stops.  20 minute walk to the city subway-green line.  MBTA website can help plan your travel on public transportation.
access: Entire apartment. No access to outside property/yards or driveway. No parking on property.
interaction: I can be contacted via text.
house_rules: Please download the free Airbnb app for easy, accessible communication.  I will message you the address and entry instructions a couple days before you arrive. The keypad code will be sent separately. Thank you for booking with us.  House Rules ***A reminder: To ensure that all guests/tenants are comfortable and have a pleasant experience, cooking food that leaves pungent odors is not allowed.  No cooking or frying of foods, oils or spices that are heavily aromatic.  Kitchen is for light cooking only.  Please use the venting fan when cooking.  If this rule is broken an additional fee of $100.00 will be charged for cleaning and airing out of the apartment.***    Please, NO cars in the driveway at any time, even if just to load/unload car.  Spaces are rented and you may be towed. If an early check in is possible we will notify you on your check in date.  Otherwise, expect to check in at 3pm. Please be respectful of noise as there are other long-term tenants and guests in the building.
host_about: Our house is in a section of Boston called Brighton, which is 8 miles from the Boston Common. We love the city of Boston and have lived here for the past 25 years.

name: ★ In front of subway ★ Free parking spot★ Location
summary: Cute 1 bedroom apartment in front of the subway with free parking. You can leave your car parked and explore Boston. Close to BU and BC. Harvard is 11 min drive! Walking distance to Brighton's Medical Area, grocery stores, bars, restaurants, and more. Full stocked kitchen and big Smart TV. Our home has great value for 4 people if you want to save money compared to a bigger place. No stairs! Just a few by the entrance of the building. Apartment is on the 1st floor! Can't wait to host for you!

name: Stylish Private Room in the Best Location
summary: This is one private bedroom in a renovated 4 bedroom apartment. The apartment has 2 full bathrooms, fully equipped kitchen and even a hot tub. Entire place is designed for the comfort of Airbnb guests. Super Easy self check-in/checkout. In 5 mins walking radius you'll find the best collection of Brookline's restaurants, cafes, nightlife and shopping. Excellent access to public transportation awaits you as this is the heart of everything. Questions before booking? No problem, just e-mail!
space: Very convenient location with lots of public transportation options very close and many highly rated restaurants and shops nearby. The full bathroom has provided towels, shampoo and body wash. Bedding is completely laundered after every guest. The full bathroom  has provided towels, shampoo and body wash. The apartment will be thoroughly cleaned prior to each guests stay. The kitchen is available for use and the dishwasher makes clean up easy. If you want to stow away your belongings and clothes, feel free to use the wardrobe in the room. There may be additional guests staying in the apartment during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking. We never accept the guests with no verification or negative reviews from their previous hosts. Cleaning is priority for us and we expect from our guests to respect it.  Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a guest house while providing the comfort of home.

neighborhood_overview: Boston is Massachusetts’ capital and largest city. Founded in 1630, it’s one of the oldest cities in the U.S. The key role it played in the American Revolution is highlighted on the Freedom Trail, a 2.5-mile walking route of historic sites that tells the story of the nation’s founding. One stop, former meeting house Faneuil Hall, is a popular marketplace.Affluent Back Bay is a shopping and dining destination. Along Newbury Street, well-heeled locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. Expansive Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue.The South End is a culturally rich neighborhood with restored Victorian row houses surrounding charming English-style squares. Its popular dining and drinking scene spans family-friendly bistros, trendy eateries, gay bars and low-key pubs. The
notes: My Crew and I are Available for the Guest at All Times.
transit: We are located right on the Subway T Green Line that takes you anywhere into Downtown Boston. Uber and Lyft available on Demand, and Walk Walk Walk!!!

host_about: I love spending time with my family and traveling the world!

name: (S4) Hotel like Suite in Downtown Boston! BEST!
summary: The Financial District is downtown’s business nerve center, crowded with stately banks, high-rise offices and sleek condos. Post Office Square, home to Norman B. Leventhal Park, offers a green respite with a lawn, sculptural fountain and garden trellises. Suited professionals frequent the district's chain eateries, lunch spots and high-end coffee shops. Swanky lounges and boisterous Irish pubs draw after-work crowds.
space: This space is priced better than neighboring hotel rooms and have the added bonus of a suite like layout! The space is roughly 900 sq ft, direct elevator access to your unit, King size bed, comfortable couch with cable tv and high speed Wifi! The unit does not have a kitchen but it does provide a small fridge/freezer, electric kettle, kurig coffee maker, microwave, wine glasses, drinking glasses, coffee mugs, and silverware. Enjoy the comfort of a luxury suite for a lower price and the convenience of an Airbnb. This unit is spectacular! Great for short stays and business stays!

name: Boutique Hotel Room - Charlesmark Hotel
summary: Originally built in 1886 as a private residence in the heart of Boston's Back Bay neighborhood, the hotel has been completely renovated. Our European style boutique hotel features a hip cocktail lounge with an outdoor patio. Premier location. Exceptional value. European ambiance. The Charlesmark combines it all to create a memorable lodging experience. Ambiance - Genuine, Intimate Service **Taxes ARE included in your rate** Also Included:  * A free light Continental breakfast * Wifi
space: Our Standard Rooms feature a Full size bed. As we are located in the heart of historic boston our standard rooms are on the smaller size when compared to suburban chain hotels. Your room is located in our Boutique Hotel - every room has a custom sound system, DVD & VHS players and features our library of classic and modern movies to enjoy throughout your stay.  Just steps away from the "T" (the Boston Subway system) we are within a short walk to many historic places in Boston and a quick trip away from anywhere the city.

neighborhood_overview: Back Bay is a shopping and dining destination. Along Newbury Street (one block behind our hotel), locals and visitors frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses.  To the front of our hotel Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Nearby mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue.
notes: NA
transit: Just steps away from the MBTA's T (subway) "Green Line" you can get to all of boston's ground transportation within just a few minuets. If you are arriving via air, we are directly across from the Massport Logan express which runs daily trips every 20 minutes to and from Logan Airport.
access: Our bar and lounge is open from 5 to midnight or later each day. We have an attached restaurant that features authentic Italian ingredients. The restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. Our handcrafted cocktails are available in our lounge and in the attached restaurant Ora Trattorizza each evening.
interaction: We are on staff 24 hours a day to help you get the most out of your trip to Boston. Need Trolley tickets, a map, personal recommendations? We're here for you.
house_rules: Events and parties should be booked ahead of time, please message us for details.

name: Allston master suite - Queen bed/Private bathroom2
summary: A gorgeous master suite (Queen bedroom and private bathroom with shower) in the hearth of Allston, Boston conveniently connected to Cambridge and minutes walk to Boston Landing train station.
space: The master suite is part of a beautiful newly renovated 3 bedrooms townhouse where your hosts: Mouna, Philippe, and a cat, are living.  Conveniently located in the heart of Allston, the house is well connected to Cambridge Central Square (20min bus, 15min bike), Harvard Business / Kennedy School (15min bus, 10min bike), as well as Boston (3min walk to Boston landing), Brookline, Boston university, or Brighton.  Street parking is generally available around the house (none permit parking area is available in Braintree St. and Penniman Rd.).

At just 150 square feet the suite is beautifully furnished and because of its size we are able to offer exceptional prices!   This unit features carpet throughout, there is a a queen over XL full bed bunk bed, a separate wardrobe and dresser for hanging and storing clothes, plus comfortable seating.  Limited kitchen inside the room!  Photos may be of similar listing!

Each floor has a full size oven/stove for more involved cooking or baking item, it's not in the room to save space! Dining table not included, many great restaurants nearby for you to enjoy!  There is a a queen over XL full bed bunk bed. Its most comfortable for 3 adults but can sleep 4!  This efficiency suite features a fully-equipped kitchenette and living area. The flooring is carpeted throughout, with ceramic tile in the bathroom. The bathroom has a beautiful, white tile enclosed shower. The kitchenette is fully equipped with pots, pans and cooking utensils, along with a two burner hot plate for cooking meals. The flat screen HD Smart TV (making watching programs like Netflix a snap) is equipped with local channels and HDMI inputs that can be used to connect a computer to view online content. neighborhood_overview: The Boston Common Park and Public Garden are only a few hundred feet away and Fenway Park is a quick 15 minutes away by train. Public transit by way of the Red, Orange and Green Subway lines is only a minute walk from the property. Grocery, dining and shopping are all within a few minute walk of the property. You can pick up the Freedom Trail very near the Boston Common. MGH, Tuft’s Medical, Boston University, Emerson College and many other hospitals and schools are within 5-30 minute walk or a short ride on public transit. Running or watching the Boston Marathon? The Boston Marathon Finish Line is just a short 12 minute walk away! Easy walk or T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common Convenient to many colleges such as Emerson, Berkeley, BU, Boston College, UMASS, Mass College of Pharmacy, Suffolk, MIT, Harvard, Tufts, Tufts Dental, and more!
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Smoking of any kind is forbidden in the apartment, the common areas, on the front steps of the building or within 50 feet of the building entrance.  Smokers can go to the small park at the end of the block. Photos may be of similar listing! Do not see the dates you are looking for? Contact us anyways so I can see if I can accommodate you somewhere else!
transit: NA
access: You'll receive high quality towels and linens, coffee, shampoo and conditioner, an iron, ironing board, and hair dryer.
interaction: Always available during the day via Airbnb and on the phone at night!
house_rules: House Rules You will be staying in a residential rental building with Airbnb guests and long term tenants so please abide by the following rules: -No smoking, smoking is strictly prohibited both inside and within 50ft of the outside of the building.  -Please respect our neighbors by not having any additional guests.  -No parties, quiet hours begin at 9pm. -No pets. -No packages may be sent to the building. -Leave the room as you found it. -If you are a local, please do not instant book, contact us first. -Heat is controlled by the building so some rooms run warm!

neighborhood_overview: Boston is Massachusetts’ capital and largest city. Founded in 1630, it’s one of the oldest cities in the U.S. The key role it played in the American Revolution is highlighted on the Freedom Trail, a 2.5-mile walking route of historic sites that tells the story of the nation’s founding. One stop, former meeting house Faneuil Hall, is a popular marketplace. - The sprawling Fenway-Kenmore area is home to baseball’s iconic Fenway Park, drawing huge crowds for Red Sox games. Student hangouts and buzzy restaurants are concentrated around Kenmore Square, and clubs and sports bars line Lansdowne Street. Renowned cultural institutions include the Museum of Fine Arts and quirky Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum. The rambling Back Bay Fens park has a rose garden and walking trails. - Cambridge is a city on the River Cam in eastern England, home to the prestigious University of Cambridge, dating to 1209. University colleges include King’s, famed for its choir and towering Gothic chapel, as well as T

neighborhood_overview: Your studio is located in the Bay Village neighborhood of Boston. It is nestled between Back Bay, the South End, and the Theatre District which make it the perfect spot for any traveler. Bay Village, is filled with local charm, is steps from public transportation and is near many wonderful restaurants and cafes. The street is lined with brick homes and traditional gas lamps. Although seeing Boston by foot is easy in a location so central, we are located near numerous buses and trains too. We are a 7 minute walk to the orange line at Tufts Medical Center, a short 6 minute walk to the green line to catch a Sox game at Fenway, and minutes to many local buses. Running or watching the Boston Marathon? The Boston Marathon Finish Line is just a short 12 minute walk away! Easy walk or T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common Convenient to many colleges such as Emerson, Berkeley, BU, Boston College, UMASS, Mass

Swanky lounges and boisterous Irish pubs draw after-work crowds.

host_about:
Hi there!
Thanks for looking into my profile . My name is Hasan. I work for a financial technology firm as a head of business development. As a side gig, I have been an airbnb host for 3 years managing 8 units in Boston and Cambridge. 

As you may have already seen, hotel prices are insanely expensive in Boston.  Thankfully, we are still able to offer affordable stays for those who are on a tight budget for their travel despite the fact that the city and hotel lobbies are cracking down on airbnb.

Why Do I host?
 I love the fact that people can still find affordable stays through Airbnb. When a family of 4 visits their daughter in May for graduation, they can book a place for $250/night instead of paying over $1000/night for a hotel stay. It means a lot to me! ( there was a time my parents could not come from overseas to visit me just because we could not afford their stay! ) 

My priority is to provide well located affordable stays to families and business travelers. I guarantee you that you will find a clean, well designed and conveniently located units with 24/7 assistance . 

However, if you have high standards, luxury buildings or jacuzzi tubs in the unit, my apartments may not be best option for you: Considering over $4000/month rents for a rundown building in Boston, I am not able to afford high end buildings to host guests on airbnb. You shall look for different options for your satisfactions. 

For others, I am more than happy to host you! Let's keep this community happy

Regards,
Hasan

host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm originally from Atlanta but have been living Boston in the famous the North End of Boston for the last 15 years.  Last summer I had the pleasure of AirBnB'ing in St. Petersburg Florida and I'm looking forward to continuing that here in Boston.  I owned and operated a hostel in downtown Boston for six years and I'm a big fan of hostels, so the spaces I rent are often shared.
.  
I love traveling, meeting travelers and helping them out with finding affordable accommodation where ever I am.  I'm opening another hostel soon and thought this would be a great way to continue what I like to do in the meantime.  Safe Travels!!

summary: My place is close to Boston University, Fenway, Kenmore square, Allston, Downtown Boston. This is a private bedroom in a simple apartment located on a quite street 1 min from Boston University, 1 min walk from public transportation, 5 min from Fenway/Kenmore, 10 min from Downtown and Harvard. Internet, and Netflix available. Have the best of both worlds: a quiet large modest home and fast access to the best of Boston and Cambridge. Open kitchen and refrigerator, central heat, washer.
space: This place is not for everyone. Upon booking, one of the cohosts will contact you to welcome you and give you directions for your self check in. You will follow instructions on how to find your room. Your room is equipped with a fan, large bed, a desk, and desk lamp. You will be sharing the living room, kitchen and bathrooms with other guests just like you. There are no locks to the bedrooms, or to the house doors, however the house is extremely safe and have an updated security system. There is a great backyard, and a beautiful patio.  So if you are ok with a private clean bedroom and don't mind sharing the common areas, this place is for you.

neighborhood_overview: When you start college in Boston, especially at BU or BC, you hear about Allston and its infamous house parties. It sounds like a magical land of freedom. This neighborhood has character and is filled with impressive street art that has been sponsored by the city to keep graffiti and “tagging” off the walls. We think this neighborhood is worth paying a visit to if you’re looking for something a little off the beaten path. A little hipster, yes, a little grungy, sure, but full of rich culture, cool cats, and great food of all types—especially all foods Asian. Its main streets are lined with places to sip, shop, shoot pool, and play old-school arcade games.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: It's one min walk from Harvard Avenue stop on the Green line.  Our apartment is located close to: - Boston University - Boston College - Harvard University - Fenway Park Together, Allston-Brighton comprises countless super-cool niches, whether you prefer playing late-night dive bar darts or sipping early morning coffee in movie-set worthy cafes.
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner. USA Taxes request will be sent through airbnb after the booking is over.
interaction: The major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.

Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. There are no keys to the room or doors but we have safe boxes to store your valuables. - 7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. summary: This single twin bed is in a shared room with other solo AirBnB travelers and is located right in the downtown area.  Perfect for friends visiting other friends located at one of the many colleges in Boston.  If you've enjoyed staying at a hostel before for the economic value and ease of making new friends, then this is perfect for you.  This is bed is for one person only.
space: The room is located on the upper floor of a recently renovated historic Boston building.  There is no lift or elevator.
description: This single twin bed is in a shared room with other solo AirBnB travelers and is located right in the downtown area.  Perfect for friends visiting other friends located at one of the many colleges in Boston.  If you've enjoyed staying at a hostel before for the economic value and ease of making new friends, then this is perfect for you.  This is bed is for one person only. The room is located on the upper floor of a recently renovated historic Boston building.  There is no lift or elevator. Guests are welcome to come and go as they please, as long as it doesn't disturb other guests staying in the shared rooms.  There is no curfew.  Just be kind to others staying in your room.  There is no sharing beds. We would also like to note that the shared guest shower room is currently only open during the hours of 10a-6pm Monday through Saturday, and 11am-5pm on Sunday.  We are completing some remodeling additions that will fix this.  We offer two bathrooms with toilets and sinks to guest that a
neighborhood_overview: The heart of downtown Boston is right outside the front door.
notes: NA
transit: The Park Street Green Line T is only steps away, as well as the Orange Line, which is less than a minute walk away.  This location is ideal.
access: Guests are welcome to come and go as they please, as long as it doesn't disturb other guests staying in the shared rooms.  There is no curfew.  Just be kind to others staying in your room.  There is no sharing beds. We would also like to note that the shared guest shower room is currently only open during the hours of 10a-6pm Monday through Saturday, and 11am-5pm on Sunday.  We are completing some remodeling additions that will fix this.  We offer two bathrooms with toilets and sinks to guest that are available 24/7.    Lastly, we provide a secure locker for each bed, but please bring your own lock if you require locking your personal belongings.
interaction: We are always available to our guests for questions or suggestions on things to do in this great city.
house_rules: This is a soon to be hostel in Boston.  Please no sharing beds, smoking, vaping or drinking alcohol in the building.  This ain't that kind of place.  Please respect others belongs, as you'd want them to respect yours.  If you need to smoke cigarettes please do so outside and down the street away from the front door. The shower room is available during 10a-6p each day.  We are happy to provide you with a clean towel for free to use during your stay with us.
host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm originally from Atlanta but have been living Boston in the famous the North End of Boston for the last 15 years.  Last summer I had the pleasure of AirBnB'ing in St. Petersburg Florida and I'm looking forward to continuing that here in Boston.  I owned and operated a hostel in downtown Boston for six years and I'm a big fan of hostels, so the spaces I rent are often shared.
.  
I love traveling, meeting travelers and helping them out with finding affordable accommodation where ever I am.  I'm opening another hostel soon and thought this would be a great way to continue what I like to do in the meantime.  Safe Travels!!

name: Quiet Pondside Room Near Boston College
summary: A quiet, cozy and private room in a second floor condominium building across a pond  in a quiet and safe neighborhood,  wonderful for strolls.
space: The guest room has a large window, big closet, dresser/mirror, two night stands and desk with a chair, decorated in pastel colors with a great shared bathroom outside the room. Guests are welcome to sit at the living room if they wish.
description: A quiet, cozy and private room in a second floor condominium building across a pond  in a quiet and safe neighborhood,  wonderful for strolls. The guest room has a large window, big closet, dresser/mirror, two night stands and desk with a chair, decorated in pastel colors with a great shared bathroom outside the room. Guests are welcome to sit at the living room if they wish. I'll be here when you arrive to give you the key to your room. On Mondays and Fridays check-in time is at 7:00 pm.  All the other days check-in time is at 3:00 pm. In a radius of 5 miles you can find: Boston College (10 minute walk), Boston University (20 minutes away on the T),  Education First (EF) (8 minute walk),  St. Elizabeth Hospital (by bus 7 minutes), WGBH, and Boston Landing   This is a lovely corner of Brighton, housing young professionals, college students, and families.  Within walking distance you will find  a CVS, a post office, a public library, a YMCA, as well as some small restaurants and coffee
neighborhood_overview: In a radius of 5 miles you can find: Boston College (10 minute walk), Boston University (20 minutes away on the T),  Education First (EF) (8 minute walk),  St. Elizabeth Hospital (by bus 7 minutes), WGBH, and Boston Landing   This is a lovely corner of Brighton, housing young professionals, college students, and families.  Within walking distance you will find  a CVS, a post office, a public library, a YMCA, as well as some small restaurants and coffee shops.
notes: NA
transit: The last train stop on the B Green line, Boston College, is within walking distance, as well as the bus stop for the 57, 501, and 503 buses.

name: *GREAT LOCATION LUXURY ROOM *ST ELZBT/ HOSP& BC/BU
summary: Enjoy the comfortable bedroom located inside Brighton, a neighborhood of Boston which is filled with many restaurants,coffee shops, bars, and parks.  Our place is near Saint Elizabeth hospital, Boston University, Boston College, Harvard University, and Cambrige area (Charles River). This is a safe and very good area for tourists and all ages alike. The MIT museum is very close, and concerts near too for entertainment. Our place will have free private parking as well as free street parking.
space: We will provide towels along with shampoos, body wash,etc. As for parking there will a FREE PRIVATE spot for all our guests. There is also free street parking which is accessible. In the bedrooms there  are hangers for clothes, jackets, etc. We have also provided "MINI REFRIGERATOR which will have cold drinks, TV which offers a variety of shows and movies by AMAZON FIRE also A/C ,there will also be snacks provided for our guests in the rooms. We will give our guests their privacy, although if anything is needed we are friendly and live on the first floor.

name: Spacious 1 Bedroom in the heart of Beacon Hill
summary: This is true Beacon Hill. Only a block from Charles Street. Cozy, clean, quiet apartment. This spacious 1 bedroom apartment includes a comfortable queen bed , 1 full bath room, a sofa,  a large flatscreen TV, and high-speed wifi. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything to cook simple meals, included coffee maker, blender, microwave, pots/pans and toaster etc... Location is unbeatable, walking distance to the T, the Boston Commons, restaurants, city tours, night life, and more!
space: We love our apartment for many reasons . It is super cozy and spacious, has a historic true Boston charm. And the location! You can walk down to Charles street where you can find the finest stores and the restaurants, to Charles river, and the commons. You can easily walked to Harvard sq. , to the theaters in down town.
description: This is true Beacon Hill. Only a block from Charles Street. Cozy, clean, quiet apartment. You have access to all there is. When you stay here it is your home!

host_about:
Hi I'm Lucy

I am a ballet/dance instructor. Originally from Tokyo, Japan, lived in Providence, RI for many years. I live in Cotuit with my fiancé , Scott now.
I am friendly and LOVE to host my friends and family so it was almost "meant to be" to sign up with Airbnb to become a host for Scott's lovely flat in Beacon Hill, Boston which he has owned for many years and only uses occasionally. (he teaches graduate students in Cambridge)
I am easy going and friendly.  I want all my guests to have a fantastic, memorable , and headache free (most importantly!) stay in Boston whether you are there with your friends and family or alone for business.
